Figure 1:MemoBrain asynchronously abstracts transient reasoning sessions into compact, dependency-aware memory units and maintains a global reasoning memory.
Upon reaching the memory budget, it constructs a memory-managed context by folding or flushing past information, enabling coherent long-horizon reasoning.

Table 1:Main experimental results. Best scores are shown inbold, and second-best areunderlined. We reportPass​@​1\text{Pass}@1. Results marked with†\daggerare cited from the original papers. MemoBrain results are obtained by integrating MemoBrain-8B into the corresponding base agents (GLM-4.6 and DeepResearch-30B-A3B).
Figure 2:Ablation studies of MemoBrain. All experiments are conducted on 100 randomly sampled instances from BrowseComp-Plus, using DeepResearch-30B-A3B as the base reasoning agent.

Figure 3:Efficiency Analysis of MemoBrain.
End-to-end runtime statistics on the full BrowseComp-Plus benchmark under a 32K memory budget, using 4×H100 GPUs for the reasoning model and 2×H100 GPUs for the memory model with a batch size of 8.
